properties.areaDesc: Cleveland; Arkansas; Drew; Dallas; Jefferson; Bradley; Lincoln; Desha; Ouachita; Calhoun; Grant
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 10 at 12:03PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
The Flash Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of central Arkansas, southeast Arkansas, and
southwest Arkansas, including the following areas, in central
Arkansas, Grant. In southeast Arkansas, Arkansas, Bradley,
Cleveland, Desha, Drew, Jefferson, and Lincoln. In southwest
Arkansas, Calhoun, Dallas, and Ouachita.

* Through Tuesday afternoon

* Periods of showers and thunderstorms will continue over southern
and southeast Arkansas through Tuesday. Already, rainfall of one
to two inches has occured in the last 24 hours. An additional
one to two inch rainfall is likely in the next 24 hours, with
localized amounts exceeding two inches. With an already
saturated ground, flash flooding may occur.

* Since vegetation is dormant, and not consuming much ground
water, runoff from heavy rain will be increased. This elevates
the concern for flash flooding. Also, rapid rises may occur on
creeks, small streams, and flashy rivers.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
